results.title: Freud: the hidden nature of man
results.creator_credit: International Cinemedia Centre, John Kemeny and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: Dramatizes Freud’s background, his personal struggles, and his revolutionary theories which established a new view of man. Discusses the power of the unconscious, the Oedipus complex, dream analysis, and the human personality.

results.title: Fresh water: resources at risk
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Sidney Platt
results.brief_description: This documentary takes a look at some of the threats to North America’s water supply and at the actions people are taking to protect the quality and quantity of their freshwater resources. The video begins in the Great Lakes region, where students from Michigan and Ontario test for pollution in rivers that drain into Lake Erie. On the Great Plains, members of the Future Farmers of America are using more efficient irrigation techniques to conserve water stored in the Ogallala aquifer, and they’re sealing abandoned wells that can serve as a direct route for pollution to enter the aquifer. In the Southwest, water from the Colorado River supports agriculture, provides drinking water for city dwellers, and generates electricity - but dams and canals have altered the dynamics of the river. Scientists and students team up to study how the Glen Canyon Dam in Arizona has affected the balance of life in the Grand Canyon. The video wraps up in south Florida, where the increasing demand for water from agriculture and growing urban areas threatens life in the Everglades. In response to public service announcements and other educational efforts, Floridians are learning how they can help conserve their fresh water - tips that apply to people all around North America. Includes a brief teacher’s guide.

results.title: Fresh water from the sea
results.creator_credit: Hearst Metrotone and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: Serious water shortages everywhere have led scientists to seek to transform sea water into fresh water. Two of these conversion plants, one in San Diego, California and the other in Freeport, Texas, are shown in operation.

results.title: Frenzy [DVD]
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s penultimate film and his first made in England for 20 years, ‘Frenzy’ was concerned with many of the same preoccupations that dominated his earlier work including those around the motifs of the doppelganger, the wrong man and violent sexual deviance. Post-Carnaby London is terrorised by a rapist-murderer known as the ‘Necktie Killer’. An innocent ex-R.A.F. pilot, down on his luck, is accused of the murders and condemned to life imprisonment but a police inspector continues to have doubts about his guilt. Mixing black-humour and slapstick with disturbing sexual violence, the film received the critical praise denied his three previous films but was not a commercial success. Cast includes Jon Finch, Alec McCowen, Barry Foster and Barbara Leigh-Hunt. Screenplay by Anthony Schaffer, based on Arthur Le Bern’s novel ‘ Goodbye Piccadilly, Hello Leicester Square’. Photographed by Gil Taylor. Edited by John Jympson. Music by Ron Goodwin.

results.title: French twist = Gazon maudit [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Renn Productions, TF1 Films productions, Les Films Flan, Canal+, Pierre Grunstein and Josiane Balasko
results.brief_description: Josiane Balasko wrote, directed and starred in this French comedy of manners about fidelity and modern marriage. Loli (Victoria Abril) is a Spanish woman who has given up a career as a dancer for the role of suburban housewife. Her French husband, Laurent (Alain Chabat), is a real estate agent and chronic philanderer. Loli knows little of his extensive exploits, bar one affair when he was caught in the act. One day a van breaks down out the front of Loli’s house and the driver, Marijo (Balasko), comes in search of assistance. Marijo, a free-spirited lesbian, falls for Loli, who reciprocates her lust. Being displaced in the marital bed by a lesbian horrifies Laurent but his outrage is baseless, as his own transgressions have been revealed. Thus ensues a comic set-up involving love, sex, marriage and a battle of sexuality. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: French kiss
results.creator_credit: Working Title Films, Prufrock Pictures, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Meg Ryan, Kathryn F. Galan and Lawrence Kasdan
results.brief_description: Kevin Kline and Meg Ryan star in this romantic comedy about two people stuck in Paris, France. The most romantic city in the world. A place where anything can happen. And it does!
